summary: The diff adds the three new homepage sections and wires the homepage to fetch a backend-provided config via React Query with a fallback default. However, the navigation/anchor behavior does not meet the requested category-link scrolling behavior, and the backend method is not implemented as a query as required. The configured brand name also does not reflect the requested "Coding Company Corporation" option in the backend-provided config.

missing_requirements.requirement: Header navigation links must scroll to matching homepage section anchor ids, including for the categories already shown (e.g., men, women, children, infants, jewelry, shoes, pets), and provide a working mobile navigation experience with the same links.
missing_requirements.reason: Mobile navigation exists, but the nav items implemented are Lifestyle/NFTs/Featured/Why Us rather than the specified category anchors (men, women, children, infants, jewelry, shoes, pets). This does not satisfy the acceptance criteria examples for category scrolling links.

missing_requirements.requirement: Backend canister must expose at least one query method returning a single configuration object (store name, hero headline/description, categories id/title/description).
missing_requirements.reason: The backend exposes getConfig as a shared update call (`public shared ({ caller }) func getConfig()`), not a query method as required.
evidence: backend/main.mo (public shared ({ caller }) func getConfig() : async Config)

missing_requirements.requirement: Support the brand name "Coding Company Corporation" by sourcing displayed brand/store name from backend config and using it consistently for accessible text, with a sensible default.
missing_requirements.reason: While the frontend is data-driven and uses brandName for alt/sr-only text, the backend-provided brandName is hardcoded to "Linden Storefront" rather than providing/supporting the requested "Coding Company Corporation" option via backend configuration.

hallucinated_features.description: Added extra "Our Story" section inside the CategoryShowcase component.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by REQ-4/REQ-5/REQ-6/REQ-7; REQ-4 only asked for Featured Collections, Why Shop With Us/trust highlights, and a Newsletter/CTA below the hero.

hallucinated_features.description: Footer includes links to #about, #contact, #careers, and #shipping anchors that are not shown as implemented sections in the diff.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested, and may introduce broken anchor navigation if those sections do not exist.

hallucinated_features.description: Backend config changes homepage categories to Lifestyle and NFTs rather than the described multi-category fashion set (men/women/children/infants/jewelry/shoes/pets) that the homepage currently uses by default.
hallucinated_features.reason: The request was to provide the category list used on the homepage; swapping to unrelated categories was not requested and also misaligns with the REQ-5 anchor-id examples.
evidence: frontend/src/App.tsx (default categories: men, women, children, infants, jewelry, shoes, pets)
